## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> class - Representation of each machine instruction operand.

This class isn&#39;t a POD type because it has a private constructor, but its destructor must be trivial. Functions like <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a469e271fba3a9b52dad4fa54eaf44e2b">MachineInstr::addOperand()</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineregisterinfo/#a557ce2bfb3c946e43d65d750b2537987">MachineRegisterInfo::moveOperands()</a>, and MF::DeleteMachineInstr() depend on not having to call the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> destructor.

Definition at line 48 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> hash&#95;value overload.

Note that this includes the same information in the hash that isIdenticalTo uses for comparison. It is thus suited for use in hash tables which use that function for equality comparisons only. This must stay exactly in sync with isIdenticalTo above.

### clearParent() {#a800c03587b02047d71c6ba2f7b2193eb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::MachineOperand::clearParent ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
clearParent - Reset the parent pointer.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> copy constructor also copies ParentMI, expecting the original to be deleted. If a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> is ever stored outside a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a>, the parent pointer must be cleared.

Never call <a href="#a800c03587b02047d71c6ba2f7b2193eb">clearParent()</a> on an operand in a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h/#l00254">254</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isRenamable() {#a8be49bc86b5d01b52b90baf1b4477667}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool MachineOperand::isRenamable () const">
isRenamable - Returns true if this register may be renamed, i.e.

it does not generate a value that is somehow read in a way that is not represented by the Machine IR (e.g. to meet an ABI or ISA requirement). This is only valid on physical register operands. Virtual registers are assumed to always be renamable regardless of the value of this field.

Operands that are renamable can freely be changed to any other register that is a member of the register class returned by MI-&gt;getRegClassConstraint().

isRenamable can return false for several different reasons:


<ul>
<li>ABI constraints (since liveness is not always precisely modeled). We conservatively handle these cases by setting all physical register operands that didn’t start out as virtual regs to not be renamable. Also any physical register operands created after register allocation or whose register is changed after register allocation will not be renamable. This state is tracked in the MachineOperand::IsRenamable bit.</li>
<li>Opcode/target constraints: for opcodes that have complex register class requirements (e.g. that depend on other operands/instructions), we set hasExtraSrcRegAllocReq/hasExtraDstRegAllocReq in the machine opcode description. Operands belonging to instructions with opcodes that are marked hasExtraSrcRegAllocReq/hasExtraDstRegAllocReq return false from <a href="#a8be49bc86b5d01b52b90baf1b4477667">isRenamable()</a>. Additionally, the AllowRegisterRenaming target property prevents any operands from being marked renamable for targets that don&#39;t have detailed opcode hasExtraSrcRegAllocReq/hasExtraDstRegAllocReq values.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h/#l00438">438</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoperand-cpp/#l00124">124</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoperand-cpp">MachineOperand.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### print() {#aedeaf186a99c875b4196318a4083ff77}

<MemberDefinition

Providing a valid <code>TRI</code> and <code>IntrinsicInfo</code> results in a more target-specific printing. If <code>TRI</code> and <code>IntrinsicInfo</code> are null, the function will try to pick it up from the parent.

### print() {#a76123bb0e0b41f5dbae594726160db22}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MachineOperand::print (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; os, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/moduleslottracker">ModuleSlotTracker</a> &amp; MST, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> TypeToPrint, std::optional&lt; unsigned &gt; OpIdx, bool PrintDef, bool IsStandalone, bool ShouldPrintRegisterTies, unsigned TiedOperandIdx, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetintrinsicinfo">TargetIntrinsicInfo</a> &#42; IntrinsicInfo) const</>}>
More complex way of printing a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a>.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="TypeToPrint">specifies the generic type to be printed on uses and defs. It can be determined using <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a9dbc9a748353035febcc488160ba9956">MachineInstr::getTypeToPrint</a>.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="OpIdx">- specifies the index of the operand in machine instruction. This will be used by target dependent MIR formatter. Could be std::nullopt if the index is unknown, e.g. called by <a href="#a71453c9c9ea541dab5841a0b590d56ee">dump()</a>.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="PrintDef">- whether we want to print <code>def</code> on an operand which isDef. Sometimes, if the operand is printed before &#39;=&#39;, we don&#39;t print <code>def</code>.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="IsStandalone">- whether we want a verbose output of the MO. This prints extra information that can be easily inferred when printing the whole function, but not when printing only a fragment of it.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ShouldPrintRegisterTies">- whether we want to print register ties. Sometimes they are easily determined by the instruction&#39;s descriptor (MachineInstr::hasComplexRegiterTies can determine if it&#39;s needed).</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="TiedOperandIdx">- if we need to print register ties this needs to provide the index of the tied register. If not, it will be ignored.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="TRI">- provide more target-specific information to the printer. Unlike the previous function, this one will not try and get the information from it&#39;s parent.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="IntrinsicInfo">- same as <code>TRI</code>.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h/#l00310">310</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoperand-cpp/#l00800">800</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineoperand-cpp">MachineOperand.cpp</a>.

### readsReg() {#a3be9857a09c82046b77a71918b5e214f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::MachineOperand::readsReg () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
readsReg - Returns true if this operand reads the previous value of its register.

A use operand with the &lt;undef&gt; flag set doesn&#39;t read its register. A sub-register def implicitly reads the other parts of the register being redefined unless the &lt;undef&gt; flag is set.

This refers to reading the register value from before the current instruction or bundle. Internal bundle reads are not included.

### IsDeadOrKill {#a80877a58aaa58d3e92c40dd2b0573442}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::MachineOperand::IsDeadOrKill">
IsDeadOrKill For uses: IsKill - Conservatively indicates the last use of a register on this path through the function.

A register operand with true value of this flag must be the last use of the register, a register operand with false value may or may not be the last use of the register. After regalloc we can use recomputeLivenessFlags to get precise kill flags. For defs: IsDead - True if this register is never used by a subsequent instruction. This is only valid on register operands.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h/#l00110">110</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>.

### IsInternalRead {#a9adece572aa84b7c3eaa96d784f21b94}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::MachineOperand::IsInternalRead">
IsInternalRead - True if this operand reads a value that was defined inside the same instruction or bundle.

This flag can be set on both use and def operands. On a sub-register def operand, it refers to the part of the register that isn&#39;t written. On a full-register def operand, it is a noop.

When this flag is set, the instruction bundle must contain at least one other def of the register. If multiple instructions in the bundle define the register, the meaning is target-defined.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h/#l00143">143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### IsUndef {#a4cda16cd0cf564882565648b77ad8669}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::MachineOperand::IsUndef">
IsUndef - True if this register operand reads an &quot;undef&quot; value, i.e.

the read value doesn&#39;t matter. This flag can be set on both use and def operands. On a sub-register def operand, it refers to the part of the register that isn&#39;t written. On a full-register def operand, it is a noop. See <a href="#a3be9857a09c82046b77a71918b5e214f">readsReg()</a>.

This is only valid on registers.

Note that an instruction may have multiple &lt;undef&gt; operands referring to the same register. In that case, the instruction may depend on those operands reading the same dont-care value. For example:

%1 = XOR undef %2, undef %2

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> register can be used for %2, and its value doesn&#39;t matter, but the two operands must be the same register.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h/#l00132">132</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### CreateRegMask() {#a4c01d756ca363aef75429d61d21c0c14}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static MachineOperand llvm::MachineOperand::CreateRegMask (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> uint32&#95;t &#42; Mask)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
CreateRegMask - Creates a register mask operand referencing Mask.

The operand does not take ownership of the memory referenced by Mask, it must remain valid for the lifetime of the operand.

A RegMask operand represents a set of non-clobbered physical registers on an instruction that clobbers many registers, typically a call. The bit mask has a bit set for each physreg that is preserved by this instruction, as described in the documentation for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#a51887ac7b6af3703f0a8d37b3ba6b478">TargetRegisterInfo::getCallPreservedMask()</a>.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> physreg with a 0 bit in the mask is clobbered by the instruction.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h/#l00933">933</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineoperand-h">MachineOperand.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Print a subreg index operand.

MO&#95;Immediate operands can also be subreg idices. If it&#39;s the case, the subreg index name will be printed. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a894f447628559f53d2279c9f9fae0780">MachineInstr::isOperandSubregIdx</a> can be called to check this.
